DOC.HEAD: Hotel Destroyed in Bombing, Organized Crime Suspected
DOC.TEXT: An explosion destroyed a closed resort hotel, and police said Sunday that organized crime figures were probably responsible. Five months ago, the hotel manager's son was gunned down in the street. No injuries were reported in the blast Saturday night at the U Riposo hotel in Sagone on Corsica's western coast, police investigators said. Whoever set the blast used bottles of gas and 220 pounds of unidentified explosives that smashed the foundation of the 22-room, three-story hotel, hurled rubble across the street and lit up the night sky, police said. The hotel was for sale and had been closed since the end of the summer. On Aug. 7, Jean Renouard, the son of the hotel manager, was shot to death while sitting in his car. The previous manager, Jean Dupuis, was killed in a similar fashion in 1985. Dupuis had been involved with a local citizens' law enforcement organization. Police did not explain why organized crime figures would have targeted the hotel or its staff. Organized crime in Corsica, a poor region whose main industries are fishing and tourism, has traditionally been based on kidnapping, extortion and murder. In recent years gangsters have increasingly turned their attention to drugs.
